edu.rit.pj2

Class TaskSpec

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.pj2.TaskSpec

  • public class TaskSpec
extends Object
    Class TaskSpec provides a task specification that is part of a Rule in a Job.

    Programming task specifications. To create a task specification:

    • Obtain an instance of class TaskSpec by calling the task(Class) or task(int,Class) method on a Rule, or by calling the task(Class) or task(int,Class) method on another TaskSpec. The method's argument is the task subclass.

      The following TaskSpec method calls are all optional; if not specified, a default is used. For further information, see the documentation for each method.

    • Specify the task's command line arguments by calling the args() method one or more times.

    • Specify the task's properties by calling the threads(), schedule(), and chunk() methods.

    • Specify the node capabilities required to execute the task by calling the nodeName(), cores(), and gpus() methods.

    • Specify the JVM flags for the task by calling the jvmFlags() method. The JVM flags, if any, are included on the command line of the JVM that runs the task. For example, to set the maximum size of the JVM heap to 2 gigabytes, call jvmFlags("-Xmx2000m").

    • Optionally, specify that the task must run in the job's own process by calling the runInJobProcess() method. When a job is run on a cluster, grid, or cloud, by default tasks run in separate processes on nodes other than the node where the job process is running. Specifying runInJobProcess() forces the task to run in the job's own process. Situations in which this might be necessary include:

      • The task needs to read the job's standard input.

      • The task needs to display a GUI on the job's node's screen.

      • The task needs to run in the user's account—for example, to read or write the user's files—but tasks running on other nodes do not run in the user's account.

    • Specify task-specific debugging printouts for the task by calling the debug() method. The specified debug settings will be used for the task, rather than the overall job's debug settings. For example, you can turn off debugging for the job, but turn on debugging just for a certain task.

    For example, the code 

         rule() .task (MineCoinSmp.class) .args ("0123456789abcdef", "16");

    specifies a task that will execute the code in class MineCoinSmp, with two command line arguments 0123456789abcdef and 16. Be default, the task can run on any node, the task will use all CPU cores of the node, and the task does not need any GPU accelerators.

    For further information about constructing rules, see class Rule. For further information about execution of a job, see class Job.

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int ALL_CORES
      Indicates that the task requires all the cores on the node.
      static int ALL_GPUS
      Indicates that the task requires all the GPU accelerators on the node.
      static String ANY_NODE_NAME
      Indicates that the task can run on any node of the cluster.
      static int DEFAULT_CHUNK
      Indicates that the chunk property is defaulted.
      static int DEFAULT_CORES
      Indicates that the cores property is defaulted.
      static int DEFAULT_GPUS
      Indicates that the gpus property is defaulted.
      static String DEFAULT_NODE_NAME
      Indicates that the nodeName property is defaulted.
      static Schedule DEFAULT_SCHEDULE
      Indicates that the schedule property is defaulted.
      static int DEFAULT_THREADS
      Indicates that the threads property is defaulted.
      static int STANDARD_CHUNK
      Indicates to use the standard chunk size for the schedule property.
      static int THREADS_EQUALS_CORES
      Indicates that a parallel for loop will be executed by as many threads as there are cores on the machine.

    • Method Detail

      • args

        public TaskSpec args(String... args)
        Specify the task's command line arguments. The strings specified as the args() method's arguments are appended to the task's array of command line arguments. If not specified, by default the task has no command line arguments.
        Parameters:
        args - Command line arguments (zero or more).
        Returns:
        This task specification.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if args is null or any element of args is null.

      • threads

        public TaskSpec threads(int threads)
        Specify the task's threads property. The threads property specifies the number of threads that will execute a parallel for loop. If not specified, the default is to use the threads property of the enclosing job.
        Parameters:
        threads - Number of threads (≥ 1), THREADS_EQUALS_CORES, or DEFAULT_THREADS.
        Returns:
        This task specification.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if threads is illegal.
        See Also:
        Task.threads(int)

      • schedule

        public TaskSpec schedule(Schedule schedule)
        Specify the task's schedule property. The schedule property, along with the chunk property, specifies how the iterations of a parallel for loop are partitioned among the threads executing the parallel for loop. If not specified, the default is to use the schedule property of the enclosing job. Refer to enum Schedule for descriptions of the possible schedules.
        Parameters:
        schedule - Parallel for loop schedule, or DEFAULT_SCHEDULE.
        Returns:
        This task specification.
        See Also:
        Task.schedule(Schedule), chunk(int)

      • chunk

        public TaskSpec chunk(int chunk)
        Specify the task's chunk property. The chunk property, along with the schedule property, specifies how the iterations of a parallel for loop are partitioned among the threads executing the parallel for loop. If not specified, the default is to use the chunk property of the enclosing job. Refer to enum Schedule for descriptions of the possible schedules.
        Parameters:
        chunk - Chunk size (≥ 1), STANDARD_CHUNK, or DEFAULT_CHUNK.
        Returns:
        This task specification.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if chunk is illegal.
        See Also:
        Task.chunk(int), schedule(Schedule)

      • nodeName

        public TaskSpec nodeName(String nodeName)
        Specify the task's nodeName property. The nodeName property specifies the name of the cluster node on which the task must run. The default is that the task can run on any node of the cluster.
        Parameters:
        nodeName - Node name, ANY_NODE_NAME, or DEFAULT_NODE_NAME.
        Returns:
        This task specification.
        See Also:
        Task.nodeName(String)

      • cores

        public TaskSpec cores(int cores)
        Specify the task's cores property. The cores property specifies the number of CPU cores the task requires. The default is that the task requires all the cores on the node.
        Parameters:
        cores - Number of cores (≥ 1), ALL_CORES, or DEFAULT_CORES.
        Returns:
        This task specification.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if cores is illegal.
        See Also:
        Task.cores(int)

      • gpus

        public TaskSpec gpus(int gpus)
        Specify the task's gpus property. The gpus property specifies the number of GPU accelerators the task requires. The default is none (0).
        Parameters:
        gpus - Number of GPUs (≥ 0), ALL_GPUS, or DEFAULT_GPUS.
        Returns:
        This task specification.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if gpus is illegal.
        See Also:
        Task.gpus(int)

      • jvmFlags

        public TaskSpec jvmFlags(String... jvmFlags)
        Specify the JVM flags for the task. If not specified, the default is to use the jvmFlags property of the enclosing job. The JVM flags are included on the command line of the JVM that runs the task.
        Parameters:
        jvmFlags - JVM flags (zero or more).
        Returns:
        This task specification.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if jvmFlags is null or any element of jvmFlags is null.

      • runInJobProcess

        public TaskSpec runInJobProcess()
        Specify that the task must run in the job's process. If not specified, the default is to run in another process, possibly on another node.
        Returns:
        This task specification.

      • debug

        public TaskSpec debug(Debug... debug)
        Print the given debugging messages for the task. These debug settings override the overall job's debug settings for the task.
        Parameters:
        debug - Debugging message(s) to print, or null to print none.
        Returns:
        This task specification.

      • debug

        public TaskSpec debug(Set<Debug> debug)
        Print the given debugging messages for the task. These debug settings override the overall job's debug settings for the task.
        Parameters:
        debug - Set of debugging message(s) to print, or null to print none.
        Returns:
        This task specification.

      • task

        public <T extends Task> TaskSpec task(Class<T> taskClass)
        Add the given task to this task specification's rule's task group. When this rule fires, one instance of the given task will be executed. Call methods on the returned TaskSpec object to configure the task.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Task data type.
        Parameters:
        taskClass - Task subclass.
        Returns:
        Task specification for the given task.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if taskClass is null.

      • task

        public <T extends Task> TaskSpec task(int n,
                             Class<T> taskClass)
        Add the given number of copies of the given task to this task specification's rule's task group. When this rule fires, the given number of instances of the given task will be executed. Call methods on the returned TaskSpec object to configure the tasks (all copies will be configured the same).
        Type Parameters:
        T - Task data type.
        Parameters:
        n - Number of copies (≥ 1).
        taskClass - Task subclass.
        Returns:
        Task specification for the given task.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if n < 1.
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if taskClass is null.
